text:
It’s been a little while, but if I recall you can delete the staging folders: 
1. Stop Windows Update (wuauserv) & BITS services (you may need to temporarily
 change Windows Update service to Disabled to keep Windows from restarting
 it)
 2. Delete contents of “C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution\Download” folder
 3. Delete “C:\$Windows.~BT” folder
 4. Restart Windows Update service. Check update status (“usoclient startscan”). 
Jody MacKercher 
Positron Computer Services
%40BN8PR05MB6242.namprd05.prod.outlook.com

metadata.email_text_original:
Windows 11 upgrade 
You don't often get email from jmac@pcs-consulting.net. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
It’s been a little while, but if I recall you can delete the staging folders: 
1. Stop Windows Update (wuauserv) & BITS services (you may need to temporarily
    change Windows Update service to Disabled to keep Windows from restarting
    it)
 2. Delete contents of “C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution\Download” folder
 3. Delete “C:\$Windows.~BT” folder
 4. Restart Windows Update service. Check update status (“usoclient startscan”). 
Jody MacKercher 
Positron Computer Services
